S_particles module¶

Module to handle particles’ class.

class S_particles.Particles(params)[source]¶

Bases: object

Particles class.

Parameters

params (class) – Simulation’s parameters. See S_params.py for more info.

Type

array

array

Type

array

add()[source]¶

Add more particles: specific species, and number of particles

halton_reject(bases, r_reject)[source]¶

Place particles according to a Halton sequence from 0 to L (the box length) and uses a rejection radius to avoid placing particles to close to each other.

Parameters

  • bases (array) – Array of 3 ints each of which is a base for the Halton sequence. Defualt: bases = np.array([2,3,5])

  • r_reject (float) – Value of rejection radius.

Notes

Author: Luke Stanek Date Created: 5/6/19 Date Updated: N/A Updates: N/A

lattice(perturb, rand_seed)[source]¶

Place particles in a simple cubic lattice with a slight perturbation ranging from 0 to 0.5 times the lattice spacing.

Parameters

  • perturb (float) – Value of perturbation, p, such that 0 <= p <= 1.

  • rand_seed (int) – Seed for random number generator. Default: 1.

Notes

Author: Luke Stanek Date Created: 5/6/19 Date Updated: 6/2/19 Updates: Added to S_init_schemes.py for Sarkas import

load(params)[source]¶

Initialize particles’ positions and velocities. Positions are initialized based on the load method while velocities are chosen from a Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution.

load_from_file(f_name)[source]¶

Load particles’ data from a specific file.

Parameters

  • f_name (str) – Filename

  • N (int) – Number of particles

load_from_restart(it)[source]¶

Load particles’ data from a checkpoint of a previous run

Parameters

it (int) – Timestep.

random_no_reject()[source]¶

Randomly distribute particles along each direction.

Returns

pos – Particles’ positions.

Return type

array

random_reject(r_reject, rand_seed)[source]¶

Place particles by sampling a uniform distribution from 0 to L (the box length) and uses a rejection radius to avoid placing particles to close to each other.

Parameters

  • r_reject (float) – Value of rejection radius.

  • rand_seed (int) – Seed for random number generator. Default: 1.

Notes

Author: Luke Stanek Date Created: 5/6/19 Date Updated: N/A Updates: N/A

remove()[source]¶

Remove particles: need to specify particle id

update_attributes(params)[source]¶

Update particles’ attributes.

Parameters

params (class) – S_params class containing the updated information.
